name: perjurer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person who tells lies in court when they have promised to tell the truth: The convicted perjurer is serving a four-year jail sentence. If he intentionally makes factually incorrect statements under oath, he is both a liar and perjurer. See
perjure
More examplesFewer examplesHe's an unrepentant perjurer who should lose his job unless he changes his tone.He has accused us of being perjurers and assassins.False allegations are now common, yet our criminal justice system remains unwilling to prosecute the perjurers.
